title: Meeting of the minds? Alyssa Milano and Ted Cruz agree to discuss gun policy in person
text:
Actress Alyssa Milano and Republican Texas Sen. Ted Cruz are going to meet in person to discuss gun policy in the United States after a tense back-and-forth on Twitter.

"I’d love to come in and meet with you on the gun issue and many other issues that include life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness, @tedcruz and also, 1 Peter 4:8. I’ll be in DC next week," Milano, 46, said, referencing a Bible verse that suggests everyone "love each other deeply." "We can live-stream the meeting so the American people can hear your bullshit 1st hand," she also said.

Cruz, 48, replied positively to the challenge, gesturing that the meetup could be a healing moment for the country. "I’d be happy to sit down & visit next week about uniting to stop gun violence & about the Constitution," the senator tweeted. "If we can have a civil & positive conversation—in the spirit of 1 Peter 4:8 as you suggest—despite our political differences, that might help resolve the discord in our Nation."

The agreement to meet came at the end of an argument between the conservative lawmaker and the liberal actress, who clashed over potential solutions to gun violence after the shooting in West Texas over the weekend that left seven dead and at least 21 injured.

Milano, known for her political activism that includes lobbying for strict gun control, wondered to her 3.6 million Twitter followers whether there was a Bible passage that advocated for gun rights. "Can someone cite which passage of the Bible God states it is a god-given right to own a gun?" She asked.

Cruz responded that although the Bible did not specifically mention gun ownership, there was ample precedent for citing scripture as a reason to defend yourself. "An excellent Q, worth considering carefully w/o the snark of Twitter. It is of course not the right to a modern-day firearm that is God-give but rather the right to Life & the right to Liberty. Essential to that right to life is the right to DEFEND your life & your family," he tweeted to Milano.

Milano tweeted on Tuesday afternoon that she had been in touch with Cruz's office and was awaiting an official date to meet. "Great. I just called your office. They gave me your schedulers email address. I emailed to set up a meeting. Looking forward to it."
